title: The Power of Recursion in Coding
body: Recursion is a function calling itself. Its useful for tasks like tree traversal but can lead to stack overflow if not controlled.

title: Understanding API Requests
body: APIs let programs communicate. A GET request fetches data, while a POST sends data. Always handle errors and response codes!

title: Seismic Waves and Earths Structure
body: Seismic waves help us understand Earths layers. P-waves travel through all states, but S-waves only move through solids.

title: Why Asynchronous Code Matters
body: Async programming prevents blocking. JavaScripts event loop and Promises help execute tasks efficiently without freezing apps.

title: Version Control is a Lifesaver
body: Using Git helps track changes and collaborate. Always commit meaningful updates and use branches for testing new features.

title: Plate Tectonics Explained
body: Earths crust is divided into plates that move over time. Their interaction causes earthquakes, mountains, and ocean formation.

title: Big O Notation in Simple Terms
body: Big O helps measure code efficiency. O(1) is constant time, O(n) grows linearly, and O(nÂ²) is slow for large inputs.

title: REST vs GraphQL: Choosing the Right API
body: REST is simple and caches well, but GraphQL lets clients request specific data, reducing over-fetching.

title: Magnetic Field Reversals in Earths History
body: Earths magnetic field flips every few hundred thousand years. Rock records show past reversals, helping us study plate movements.
